file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 52-76-00-05 - BAGGAGE DOOR WARNING - ADJUSTMENT/TEST

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL BAGGAGE DOOR WARNING - ADJUSTMENT/TEST EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to do a check of the baggage-door caution message. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY BAGGAGE DOOR WARNING MESSAGE - ALL 52-76-00-700-801-A ♦ OPERATIONAL CHECK EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 52-76-00 Page 1 of 4 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 52-76-00-700-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. BAGGAGE DOOR WARNING MESSAGE - OPERATIONAL CHECK A. General (1) The function of this check is to make sure that the caution message related to the baggage door is shown on the EICAS display. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM SDS 23-41-00/1 ENERGIZATION OF THE AIRCRAFT WITH AN EX- AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200 TERNAL POWER SOURCE C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 813 Baggage door D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE In the baggage compartment (rear fuse- 1 Does the task lage) Does the check of the EICAS display in the 1 Helps the other technician cockpit I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Connect the ramp interphone to permit communication between the mechanics (AMM SDS 23-41-00/1). (2) Energize the aircraft ( AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200). (3) Make sure that these doors are closed and locked: - Forward Electronic-Compartment Access-Hatch. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 700-801-A/500 52-76-00 Page 2 of 4 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL - Rear Electronic-Compartment Access-Hatch. - Cockpit Underfloor Access Hatch. - Fueling Panel Door. - Passenger-Cabin Escape-Hatches. - Service Door. - Main Door. J. Operationally Check Baggage Door Warning Message (Figure 501) SUBTASK 710-002-A (1) Do the operational check as follows: NOTE: There is a delay of 4 to 5 seconds between the locking of the door and the indications on the EICAS display. (a) Fully close the baggage door and, before you lock it, monitor the indication on the EICAS display. Result: 1 The EICAS display shows the caution message: - BAGGAGE DOOR OPN. The MFD shows these indications: - DOOR OPEN (in red). - A red square that shows the baggage door. (b) Lock the baggage door and monitor the EICAS display. Result: 1 On the EICAS display, the caution message below goes out of view: - BAGGAGE DOOR OPN. On the MFD, the indications below go out of view: - DOOR OPEN. - The red square that shows the baggage door becomes green. K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Disconnect the ramp interphone (AMM SDS 23-41-00/1). (2) Deenergize the aircraft ( AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200).
